text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.3.85, IDRS Terminal Responses, Command Code DFAST and DLITE.
A new IRM 2.3.85.1 was created to comply with the internal control requirements set forth in IRM 1.11.2.2.5, IRM Standards, Address Management and Internal Controls .

Scope and (

) Command Code (CC) DFAST and DLITE are used as a research tool for playing a list of compliance issues found on returns for a tax payer. These compliance issues have been identiﬁed by the Dependent Database (DDB) project. (
) Purpose : This IRM section provides instructions for using the Integrated Retrieval System (IDRS) Command Code DFAST and DLITE. (
) Audience : Wage & Investment (W&I), Small Business Self-Employed (SB/SE), Large Business and International (LB&I), and Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE). (
) Policy Owner : Wage & Investment (W&I). (
) Program Owner : Wage & Investment (W&I). (
) Primary Stakeholders : Wage & Investment (W&I), Small Business Self- Employed (SB/SE), Large Business and International (LB&I), and Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE). (

) Program Goals : The primary use of this command code is to display informa- tion on the issues which were identiﬁed for the tax return of a taxpayer that may have had partial or full refunds frozen under the Dependent Database project. (

) The Dependent Database (DDB) is a Rules Based selection application that designed to identify Individuals (IMF) and Businesses (BMF) claiming unen- titled tax returns. The DFAST / DLITE Command Codes provide users on-line access to the IMF returns interrogated daily for scoring and exams. This program supports RICS users to adhere tax compliance and CI in identifying Tax Schemes. Both DFAST & DLITE execute the same modules. However, users of DFAST have access to additional data and links. Users granted DLITE access were deemed not to require all the functionality of the DFAST users. (
) None or (

) Wage and Investment RICS Business partners provide design, program re- quirements and documentation. Applications Development is responsible for Operations and Maintenance of the command codes. Management (

) Taxpayer’s returns are ultimately the source of DDB’s Scoring system. All returns, e-ﬁled and paper are processed through GMF’s Scrub process which validates, and perfects returns before releasing them to “Good Tape” for stream processing. DDB’s daily IMF process reads “Good tape” selecting returns of speciﬁed business tax forms that meet deﬁned dollar thresholds. (

) Selected returns are interrogated (“scored”) through sophisticated business rules, these rules comprise IMF’s scoring model. All scored returns are written to designated IMF scoring tables under DDB’s ownership. Code DFAST and DLITE

2.3 IDRS Terminal Responses

(3) DFAST & DLITE are IDRS command code that provide a ‘scorecard’ like analysis of detected anomalies across DDB’s IMF scoring systems. DDB’s scoring tables and IMF IRP ﬁles provide the sourced data for DFAST & 2.3.85.1.5(01-30-2023) Program Controls (1) None 2.3.85.1.6(01-30-2023) Terms/Deﬁnitions/Acronyms (1) Acronyms Acronym Deﬁnition DDB Dependents Data Base BMF Business Master File IMF Individual Master File DFAST DDB’s IMF IDRS Command Code DLITE Limited version of DFAST that restricts some users of need-to- know of Taxpayer information and access to links NAP National Account Proﬁle RICS Return Integrity and Compliance Services CI Criminal Investigation DDPOL Duplicate Direct Deposit On-line

DFAST & DLITE are IDRS command code that provide a ‘scorecard’ like analysis of detected anomalies across DDB’s IMF scoring systems. DDB’s IMF scoring tables and IMF IRP ﬁles provide the sourced data for DFAST & DLITE.
